name: La Tour Eiffel de Rielle - ver 1.0 beta
description:
Looking for suggestions to improve it

=== Combo ===

Test Run (Femme Fatale) >> Eureka! = Cheap Femme Fatale

Test Run (Femme Fatale) >> Scavenge = Cheap Install

Motivation >> Eureka! = Cheap lucky Install

Same Old Thing (Test Run) >> Combo

Maker's Eye + R&D Interface + Medium = R&D lock

name: The Masked Whale
description:
Your basic Whizzard/Darwin deck. Everything revolves around getting Darwin up and growing ASAP. Personal Touches keep him at a respectable strength should the Corp purge virus counters and Surge speeds up the growth process should you need it. Feedback Implants keep the cost of breaking multi-sub ice down.

I threw in Mimic as a counter to Swordsman. Hence the name of the deck.

name: Spanish Inquisition v2
description:
Second revision of this deck.

I dropped both bishops and lone crypsis to make room for 3 knights. This turned out to be an extremely positive change and allows the deck to break into the remotes out of the blue.

Gameplan:

  • keep the corp low on cash (reina, xanadu, rooks, FAOs)
  • destroy ice in strategic places (usually rnd) with FAOs
  • dig through the rnd with medium and imps
  • trash high cost assets with imps
  • go tagme with siphons mid to late game (with plascretes/imps to help mitigate)
  • conjure nerve agent when least expected
  • use knights to breach remotes by surprise
  • deja vu use depends on situation - bring back either siphon, both imps or something important lost to damage

Gorman simply fills last influence point - it was easy mark before. I feel I usually get more out of gorman, though it is more conditional whereas easy mark helps to get back on your feet no matter what. Not sure about this yet.

If you don't have any econ card in starting hand (siphons don't count), mulligan. There are very rare times when you want to mull even with econ - example: sure gamble, deja vu, plascrete, plascrete, nerve agent. I have much fun playing this deck. Please comment so I can make it better!

name: Jinteki Kieteldood v1.3
description: Multiple small Agendas maximises the amount of Net damage taken for stealing and scoring agendas. I've seen runners dig deep in R&D, hit multiple agendas or snares and die early on. Very funny to watch. Very little ice is needed as it's the fear of hitting traps and even agendas that should keep them out.
